title: Pinocchio
creator_contributor_role: Victorian Council for Children's Films and Television, distributor
subject_group: Literature/Fairy tales - Film and video adaptations
Literature/Children's literature - Film and video adaptations
description: Episode of Series "Faerie tale theatre". Paul Rubens (aka Pee Wee Herman) stars as the puppet who wanted to be a boy in this theatrical production of Pinocchio. Carl Reiner stars as Geppetto, the kindly puppet maker who wanted a real son to love. Lainie Kazan is the Fairy who promises to turn Pinocchio into a real boy if he can prove he is kind, honest and loving. James Coburn is a wayward huckster who tries to lead the innocent puppet astray. Featuring intricate production design reminiscent of 19th Century Italian folk art, this is a lovely and loving production of Pinocchio.
related_objects: Series; S00998; Faerie tale theatre; Active; 1984
